info.title: Vital API
info.description: API for at-home health Wearables and Lab test API for digital health companies.

post.description:
Endpoint to generate a user link token, to be used throughout the vital
link process. The vital link token is a one time use token, that
expires after 10 minutes. If you would like vital-link widget to launch
with a specific provider, pass in a provider in the body. If you would
like to redirect to a custom url after successful or error connection,
pass in your own custom redirect_url parameter.

schema.title: Response Check Token Valid V2 Link Token Isvalid Post

post.description: Generate a token to invite a user of Vital mobile app to your team

REQUEST_SOURCE: VITAL-LINK
Start link token process

schema.title: Response Start Connect Process V2 Link Start Post

get.description:
REQUEST_SOURCE: VITAL-LINK
Check link token state - can be hit continuously used as heartbeat

schema.title: Response Check Link Token State V2 Link State Get

get.description: This endpoint generates an OAuth link for oauth provider

post.description: This connects auth providers that are password based.

schema.title: Providers that require password auth, whoop, renpho, peloton, zwift

post.description: This connects auth providers that are email based.

schema.title: Email providers that require emails freestyle_auth

get.description: GET List of all available providers given the generated link token.

schema.title: Response Get Providers V2 Link Providers Get

post.description:
REQUEST_SOURCE: CUSTOMER
PROVIDER_TYPE: MANUAL-PROVIDER
This connects auth providers that are password based.

schema.title: Providers that are manually added devices, such as ble devices and generated data
Response Connect Ble Provider V2 Link Provider Manual  Provider  Post

date.title: Date
date.description: Date of the specified record, formatted as ISO8601 datetime string in UTC 00:00. Deprecated in favour of calendar_date.

calendar_date.title: Calendar Date
calendar_date.description: Date of the sleep summary in the YYYY-mm-dd format. This generally matches the sleep end date.

bedtime_start.title: Bedtime Start
bedtime_start.description: UTC Time when the sleep period started

bedtime_stop.title: Bedtime Stop
bedtime_stop.description: UTC Time when the sleep period ended

timezone_offset.title: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: Timezone offset from UTC as seconds. For example, EEST (Eastern European Summer Time, +3h) is 10800. PST (Pacific Standard Time, -8h) is -28800::seconds

duration.title: Duration
duration.description: Total duration of the sleep period (sleep.duration = sleep.bedtime_end - sleep.bedtime_start)::seconds

total.title: Total
total.description: Total amount of sleep registered during the sleep period (sleep.total = sleep.rem + sleep.light + sleep.deep)::seconds

awake.title: Awake
awake.description: Total amount of awake time registered during the sleep period::seconds

light.title: Light
light.description: Total amount of light sleep registered during the sleep period::seconds

rem.title: Rem
rem.description: Total amount of REM sleep registered during the sleep period, minutes::seconds

deep.title: Deep
deep.description: Total amount of deep (N3) sleep registered during the sleep period::seconds

score.title: Score
score.description: A value between 1 and 100 representing how well the user slept. Currently only available for Withings, Oura, Whoop and Garmin::scalar

hr_lowest.title: Hr Lowest
hr_lowest.description: The lowest heart rate (5 minutes sliding average) registered during the sleep period::beats per minute

hr_average.title: Hr Average
hr_average.description: The average heart rate registered during the sleep period::beats per minute

efficiency.title: Efficiency
efficiency.description: Sleep efficiency is the percentage of the sleep period spent asleep (100% * sleep.total / sleep.duration)::perc

latency.title: Latency
latency.description: Detected latency from bedtime_start to the beginning of the first five minutes of persistent sleep::seconds

temperature_delta.title: Temperature Delta
temperature_delta.description: Skin temperature deviation from the long-term temperature average::celcius

hr_dip.title: Hr Dip
hr_dip.description: Sleeping Heart Rate Dip is the percentage difference between your average waking heart rate and your average sleeping heart rate. In health studies, a greater "dip" is typically seen as a positive indicator of overall health. Currently only available for Garmin::perc

average_hrv.title: Average Hrv
average_hrv.description: The average heart rate variability registered during the sleep period::rmssd
